author: mklement0
body:
## Summary of the new feature/enhancement

Just like this works:

```powershell
# OK, accepts an *array* of strings to cast.
[int[]] ('1', '2').GetType.FullName
```

so should this:

```powershell
# !! BROKEN - *array* of hashtables isn't meaningfully supported - and is a virtual no-op.
[pscustomobject[]] (@{ prop = 1 }, @{ prop = 2 })
```

That is, the behavior of an _array_ cast should be analogous to a scalar one, as it _mostly_ already is.

In the case of `[pscustomobject[]]`, however, the cast is virtually ignored (in reality, the input array is uselessly wrapped in a largely invisible `[psobject]` instance, as explained in #13836):

```powershell
# !! BROKEN - no conversion takes place.
PS> [pscustomobject[]] (@{ prop = 1 }, @{ prop = 2 }) | % { $_.GetType().FullName }
System.Collections.Hashtable
System.Collections.Hashtable
```


Instead, the hashtables should individually be converted to `[pscustomobject]`s and a strongly typed `[pscustomobject[]]` array should be constructed from them.
title: Make [pscustomobject] casts support *arrays* of hashtables
